Author: Êûó‰º∏ÂΩ¶
Review:
There is a parking lot at the foot of the mountain under the temple at Saigoku Sanjusansho Fudasho.
When I came here before, I remember climbing a lot of stone steps, so I was prepared, but unfortunately it is currently under construction, so I will have to go up the slope in front of me. (It's not long, but it's a nice slope no less than stairs.)

There were not many worshipers in the precincts of the main hall, partly because of the corona disaster.
I thought this time as well, but next time I will come in the hydrangea season.
The hydrangea garden in the mountains in the precincts is definitely worth seeing during the best season.

It's not the season yet, but the well-maintained cedars and other trees looked very nice.

Author: ÂÆÖË¶ãËÇá
Review:
Located 15 minutes from Keihan Mimuroto Station, it was built in the Houki era (770-781) at the request of Emperor Konin.
For lovers of Buddhist statues, there is a treasure house (open once a month, paid), where important cultural properties such as the statue of Amida Nyorai, the wooden statue of Shaka Nyorai, and the wooden statue of Bishamonten are enshrined.

Mimurotoji Temple has many profit spots, so I think it's good to remember the points...
Go through the temple gate and climb the stairs to "Mimurodo". After purifying your hands, it is said that you should touch ``Ugajin'' and ``Hosho-gyu'', ``Fukutoku-usagi'' and ``Ryu-no-kashira'' in front of the main hall, all of which are auspicious. You can also see Wakanohana and Takanohana's handprints, perhaps because of their luck. Many omikuji and ema are lined up for women.

Next to the main hall is the Amida hall, bell tower, and three-storied pagoda. It's a detour, but you should stop by.

One more thing, you can enjoy various flowers here as it is said to be a flower temple. The garden "Yorakuen" is famous. The 5,000 tsubo dry landscape garden created by Kinsaku Nakane and the strolling pond garden are filled with azaleas and hydrangeas. It's not blooming now, but I can imagine it.

In March 2022, now plum blossoms, 250 Tarebaien open. The woman at the reception at the entrance of Mimurotoji Temple asked me, "The plum blossoms are starting to bloom. Are you okay?" The entrance fee of 800 yen was a little consideration.

Ah, it's okay, there are few customers, and the scenery overlooking the plum blossoms is all for one person, so I'm satisfied enoughüëç

Author: Ëä±È≥•È¢®ÈâÑ
Review:
In the spring of 2022, the weeping plum garden will open. There are 250 red and white weeping plum trees planted in the park, and they have a nice fragrance. It is a pleasant place with a good view on the slope of the mountain that opens to the direction of Uji city. There is also a teahouse, so you can take a break while looking at the plum blossoms.
It is recommended to wear shoes that are easy to walk on as the slope is quite steep.

However, the entrance fee is expensive, there is a shop at the exit on the way back (the green tea was quite delicious), and the staff at the temple, including the stamps and the posters, make it a temple that attracts a lot of visitors. Author: mar min
Review:
2022.6.25 (Sat) visit. I thought the hydrangeas were just in full bloom. It seems that the lotus flowers are still a little early, but I was able to enjoy some blooming.
I started at 11 o'clock, went around at a normal speed, and left the gate in about 2 hours. I think it took more than 2 hours if I ate at the tea shop in the precincts. I was able to get the goshuin almost immediately without lining up.
The Times parking lot in front of the gate was 1000 yen for 2 hours and 500 yen for 1 hour after that, so for your reference, I told you the required time in my case. It was my first visit and I didn't know how long it would take. (I have reduced one star because I felt uneasy about the parking time setting of the official parking lot...)
It wasn't as crowded as I expected, and I enjoyed various types of hydrangeas.
It was a cloudy and muggy day with temperatures around 30¬∞C, so hydration was essential, and many people were walking around with portable fans. Everyone please take care and visit.

Author: Â•Ω‰∫ïÊ∑≥Ôºà„É®„Ç∑„Éç„Ç≥441Ôºâ
Review:
Mimuro Toji. Saigoku Kannon Sacred Site No. 10 Fudasho, a special head temple of the Honzan Shugen sect. The principal object of worship is Senju Kanzeon Bodhisattva.
Known for viewing azaleas, hydrangeas, rhododendrons, and autumn foliage in the garden, and lotus flowers in front of the main hall. The azalea and hydrangea gardens are open only during the flower season.
In front of the main hall, there is a large staircase. There is also a path that can be used by wheelchairs to appreciate the flowers.

Author: Yoshinori kageshima
Review:
A special head temple built in the mountains about 15 minutes on foot from Keihan Uji Station.
When visiting, I headed for Mimurotoji from Keihan Uji Station, but I didn't know how to get there, so I took a taxi waiting in front of the station and visited. According to the taxi driver, there is a bus at JR Uji Station. However, please note that the bus at Keihan Uji Station seems to operate only on holidays!
At Mimurotoji, the admission fee is 1,000 yen when the hydrangeas are in bloom.
The main hall and three-storied pagoda in the precincts are worth seeing, and the atmosphere in front of the main hall may be somewhat soothing.

Author: ‰∏≠Áî∞Ê∑≥Â≠ê
Review:
It's a short walk from the station, but I liked the atmosphere of the withered mountain temple during the fall foliage season.

The weather in the mountains is changeable, so we are busy going back and forth between sunny and cloudy weather, and the damage from the heat is small even after the rainy season.

After the steep stairs, the large lotus flowers and buds spread out in front of you, the red dragonfly that you haven't seen in a long time, and the clear singing of warblers and wild birds. Even if the thousand-armed Kannon is standing there, it doesn't feel out of place. I enjoyed the tranquility of my heart that I don't usually get.
Along the way, I got excited about traveling with an old man I didn't know.

Author: Rona Acharon
Review: Absolutely beautiful place, and has a great park for hydrangaea viewing. There is a cafe at the end of the hydrangaea park where you can get shaved ice and ice cream treats, around more or less 1500¬• per person with drink included (honey tea).

Review:
I visited on the Saigoku 33 Temple Tour.
The lotus flowers were at their best in late July.

Since I was using a car on this day, I used Times Mimurotoji-mae No. 1 for the parking lot, but frankly speaking, the price is high.
There is no detailed price setting, and it is 1000 yen even for about an hour.

*Usage fee 00:00-00:00 120 minutes 1000 yen
(However, 500 yen for 60 minutes after 120 minutes)
*Opening hours: Normal hours: 7:00-15:40 Light-up hours: 7:00-20:20

By the way, there is no other parking lot in the vicinity, and it is around Mimuroto Station, which is a little far away.

Author: „Åü„Åë„Åª„Åå„Çâ
Review:
It is about 40 minutes on foot from JR Uji Station. There is a parking lot in the temple, and it seems that there were many worshipers who came by car. My husband and I went on foot.

Mimurotoji's lotus garden is one of the most popular spots in Kyoto. When I went there, I found that there was no pond there, but lotus flowers were planted in pots and arranged side by side.

In Buddhism, the lotus is considered the most suitable flower for the Pure Land, as it stretches its stem out of unclean mud and blooms into a pure flower.

The lotus flower reminds me of a funeral altar. It is an image that is lit by a miniature light bulb, but the real thing is very beautiful. I took a picture and will upload it together.

There is also a large garden in the temple, and depending on the season, hydrangeas and azaleas bloom, which seems to be popular as well.
(Visit: 2022-07-17)

Author: „Ç∞„É≠„É≥
Review: Visited 2023/04/09. The admission fee is ¬•1,000-. I thought it was only during the plum blossom season, but it turned out to be the same price at other times as well. Personally, after climbing the azalea slope ahead, there is a bright red rhododendron in the back, but it would have been better if I could go see it now because it dries up considerably during the azalea season. thought. From the main hall, it looks like it has already bloomed, so it was a pity.

Review: When I went to see the hydrangea before corona, I thought I would never go again because I was disappointed, but I went to see the azalea. Parking was automatic. Walking is walking, but in the azalea season, the weather was nice and I was able to walk comfortably. The azaleas weren't in full bloom because they bloomed and scattered depending on the amount of sunlight, but the wall-like azaleas were spectacular. If there are a lot of people, you may have a hard time going up and going back on the same road at the dead end, but fortunately it was not very popular on the first day of the azalea garden, so I enjoyed it.

Author: È¶ôÊ∏ØÁå´
Review:
A beautiful temple full of greenery.
In the precincts of the shrine, there is Fukutokuto-san, who holds a ball with a stone egg in it.
The azaleas in the azalea garden were spectacular.

Author: jin yone
Review:
It is a visit on the Saigoku 33 temples tour.
Parking lot 1000 yen for 120 minutes, entrance fee 1000 yen per person.
Looking at other people's reviews, it seems to have improved a lot.
It is easy to imagine that the large precincts, hydrangea garden, etc. are beautifully maintained and costly. . .
The worship itself was beautiful in the fresh green, the warblers were singing, the wind was pleasant, and the view was good. However, the principal image of the main hall is not visible at all because the glass reflects.
The main hall is already closed when I take a short break to see the tower. The time is 15:38. .
Why don't you charge 1,000 yen for admission even though there are people who came later? Am I the only one who doubts that?

Author: Â∑•Ëó§Áî±Á¥ÄÂ≠ê
Review: Mimurotoji for the first time. Hydrangea is about half bloom, but I enjoyed it enough. The parking lot is right in front of Times. It was 1000 yen for 2 hours. The Times starts at 8:00 a.m. and the temple starts at 8:30. When I arrived at 8 o'clock, I was able to park with plenty of time, but it will be more crowded around next week when the flowers are in full bloom. There were toilets in the parking lot, but they were all Japanese style, not separated by gender.

Review: A 15-minute walk from Mimurotoji Station on the Keihan Uji Line, this temple has beautiful hydrangeas. It's in full bloom now. You are lucky if you can find a heart-shaped hydrangea. There is a restaurant called Hanachaya in the park, and the tea soba and mixed rice set are delicious.

I went to Mimurotoji for the first time in several years.
I visited around 11:00 on a weekday.
I was able to go around slowly without feeling crowded as I thought.

Flowering was about 5 minutes blooming, but you can fully enjoy it.

Review: Since the hydrangea garden was open, the ticket price was raised to 1,000 yen, so I was surprised that the fee was higher than expected, but it was okay to see beautiful hydrangea. Instead, the bus going to Mimurodoji has a very large interval, so you have to go with good timing,, „Ö†„Ö†. After getting off the bus, you have to walk for about 11 minutes! Review: I have been to the Hydrangea garden every year, but this was the first time that it was lit up. Only on Saturdays and Sundays from June 10th to June 25th, 19:00 to 21:00 The park is open at night, so I am happy to see the precious night hydrangeas.

Author: A'isyah Kartika Sari
Review: Although the entry fee is quite expensive (1,000¬•), it's worth it. This beautiful temple is surrounded by a garden of hydrangeas blooming in many colors. The majority of visitors are local people, so not many tourists visit this place. Highly recommended to visit during June in Hydrangea season.
